channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.

item.title: GHz acousto-optic angular momentum with tunable topological charge
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 30 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63362-w

Researchers demonstrate the on-chip synthesis of ultrasound acoustic vortices. With tunable topological properties, these GHz vibrations can interact with light beams, advancing the technology for optical structured beam generation and modulation.

item.title: Digital camouflage encompassing optical hyperspectra and thermal infrared-terahertz-microwave tri-bands
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 30 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63563-3

The authors present a digital camouflage strategy in optical/thermal infrared/terahertz/microwave bands. It mimics plant spectra in optical and creates adaptable patterns in other bands, blending with surroundings to evade multi-spectral detection.

item.title: Single photon γ-ray imaging with high energy and spatial resolution perovskite semiconductor for nuclear medicine
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 30 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63400-7

The authors demonstrate single-photon γ-ray imaging with pixelated CsPbBr3 semiconductor detector, providing enhanced energy resolution and improving performance uniformity by minimizing mechanically induced defects. This advances applications of perovskites in nuclear medicine.
item.dc:title: Single photon γ-ray imaging with high energy and spatial resolution perovskite semiconductor for nuclear medicine
